adjective.description: Typical of a class, group, or body of opinion.
examples: these courses are representative of those taken by most Harvard undergraduates

adjective.description: (of a legislative or deliberative assembly) consisting of people chosen to act and speak on behalf of a wider group.
Serving as a portrayal or symbol of something.
examples: the show should be more representative of how women really are

noun.description: A person chosen or appointed to act or speak for another or others.
examples: the Duke of Gloucester would attend the coronation as the representative of his father, King George V

noun.description: An example of a class or group.
examples: fossil representatives of lampreys and hagfishes
